title: What a 'time-stopping' £26,400 whisky tastes like
text:
This week I visited Justerini & Brooks in St James, where I was fortunate enough to be one of the first to sample The Singleton 53-Year-Old 1964 Vintage. The single malt is priced at £26,400 and is the first in the Paragon of Time collection, and it’s fair to say, time did indeed seem to stop as it passed the lips.

The whisky is spectacular, the rarest expression of The Singleton ever released, having been drawn from a recently stumbled upon single hogshead cask at the Dufftown distillery. It was discovered by Maureen Robinson, The Singleton master of malts who presented the whisky to me, along with James Mackay, head of rare and collectable spirits at Diageo.

As many whisky aficionado readers...
description: This week I visited Justerini & Brooks in St James, where I was fortunate enough to be one of the first to sample The Singleton 53-Year-Old 1964 Vintage.
